articles.description: Listen to radio commentary and follow text updates as New Zealand face Namibia at the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: Rugby World Cup: New Zealand v Namibia - radio & text

articles.description: Follow score and text updates as Hull City face Coventry City and Southampton take on Leicester City in the Championship.
articles.title: EFL: Hull v Coventry & Southampton v Leicester in Friday action

articles.description: An emotional Andy Murray dedicates a hard-earned Davis Cup win to his grandmother Ellen after revealing he missed her funeral to play.
articles.title: Murray dedicates win to grandma after missing funeral

articles.description: Dawid Malan's sublime century inspires England to a series-clinching hammering of New Zealand in the fourth and final one-day international at Lord's.
articles.title: Malan ton seals England series win over New Zealand

articles.description: Lewis Ludlam, Joe Marler and Kyle Sinckler start with Billy Vunipola on the bench for England's Rugby World Cup match against Japan on Sunday.
articles.title: England pick Ludlam to replace Curry against Japan

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at the written reasons behind Simona Halep's four-year ban from tennis for anti-doping violations.
articles.title: Why has Halep been given four-year doping ban?

articles.description: Watch highlights as Dawid Malan makes 127 and England beat New Zealand by 100 runs in the fourth one-day international at Lords to claim a 3-1 series victory.
articles.title: Malan century gives England series win over NZ

articles.description: Great Britain's Andy Murray dedicates his Davis Cup win over Switzerland's Leandro Riedi to his grandmother, after revealing he was missing her funeral to play in the tournament.
articles.title: Murray dedicates Davis Cup win to grandmother

articles.description: Max Verstappen said Red Bull were "worse than we expected" after he ended Friday practice at the Singapore Grand Prix in eighth.
articles.title: Car worse than expected in Singapore - Verstappen

articles.description: The majority of Spain's World Cup-winning squad will continue their boycott of the national team until further changes are made, saying they do not yet "feel in a safe place".
articles.title: Spanish players to continue national team boycott
